revised_title: Investigation of the Difference of Potential Produced by the Contact of Different Substances
tldr: The author investigates the difference of potential produced by the contact of various substances, focusing on metals and liquids. The study uses a modified insulation method and a condenser with a single operative metal-liquid contact to measure the potential differences. Results show that copper is positive to distilled water, while zinc and copper are nearly at the same potential when dipped in water.
